$schema.description: The JSON schema to validate this journal entry against.

date.description: The date you cupped this coffee, formatted as 'MM/DD/YYYY'.

timestamp.description: The time of this entry, as a Unix timestamp.

weight.description: The weight of the coffee beans in grams, such as '30g'.

grind.description: The number of clicks, with zero being when burrs are fully closed.

variety.description: The variety of the coffee, such as 'Pacas' or 'Gesha'.

producer.description: The farmer, collective, or coop, such as 'Nano Challa' or 'Ariz Family'.

origin.description: The area in which this coffee was grown.

roaster.description: The name of the individual or business who roasted the coffee.

roastDate.description: The date this coffee was roasted, formatted as 'MM/DD/YYYY'.

coffee.description: The coffee beans used in your cupping.

weight.description: The weight of the water in grams, such as '500g'.

temperature.description: The temperature at which you began brewing.

recipe.description: The recipe you used for your water.

water.description: The water used in your cupping.

grinder.description: The grinder make and model you used, such as 'Hario Skerton' or 'Baratza Encore'.

equipment.description: The equipment used to make this cupping.

time.description: The total time from your initial pour on dry grounds to breaking the crust.

steep.description: The steep settings you cupped with.

notes.description: Any notes on techniques used for your cupping.

recipe.description: The techniques you used to cup.

quantity.description: On a scale of 1 to 5, how intense was it?

quality.description: On a scale of 1 to 5, how much did you enjoy it?

descriptors.description: Jot down your reactions to this aspect.

aroma.description: The smell (low to high), such as 'caramel', 'peach', or 'chocolate'.

quantity.description: On a scale of 1 to 5, how intense was it?

quality.description: On a scale of 1 to 5, how much did you enjoy it?

descriptors.description: Jot down your reactions to this aspect.

acidity.description: The fruitiness (low to high), such as 'tart', 'crisp', or 'mellow'. Usually indicated by puckering/drying of the tongue or salivation.

quantity.description: On a scale of 1 to 5, how intense was it?

quality.description: On a scale of 1 to 5, how much did you enjoy it?

descriptors.description: Jot down your reactions to this aspect.

sweetness.description: The sweetness (low to high), such as 'mild', 'deep', or 'rich'. Usually indicated by how 'rounded' the fruit quality is.

quantity.description: On a scale of 1 to 5, how intense was it?

quality.description: On a scale of 1 to 5, how much did you enjoy it?

descriptors.description: Jot down your reactions to this aspect.

body.description: The texture or mouthfeel (light to heavy), such as 'watery', 'silky', 'syrupy', or 'creamy'.

quantity.description: On a scale of 1 to 5, how intense was it?

quality.description: On a scale of 1 to 5, how much did you enjoy it?

descriptors.description: Jot down your reactions to this aspect.

finish.description: The aftertaste (short to long), such as 'quick', 'lingering', or 'clean'. Don't rush this aspect.

notes.description: Any notes about this cupping, such as overall flavor.

score.description: On a scale of 1 to 10, how much did you enjoy this cupping?

actionItem.description: Any variables to change on the next cupping.
